abstract: Iran reports 226 Iranian citizens were killed and 246 remain missing after fatal stampede involving hajj pilgrims near Mecca, Saudi Arabia; handling of disaster has led to sniping between two countries.
lead_paragraph: An additional 246 Iranians remain unaccounted for, the Tasnim news agency quoted Saeed Ohadi, Iran’s director of hajj organization, as saying.

headline.main: Iran: Number of Iranians Who Died in Hajj Disaster Is Revised to 226
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iran: Number of Iranians Who Died in Hajj Disaster Is Revised to 226

snippet: An additional 246 Iranians remain unaccounted for, the Tasnim news agency quoted Saeed Ohadi, Iran’s director of hajj organization, as saying.
